edu.cuny.ai.learning
Interface DiscreteLearner

All Superinterfaces:
Learner, Resetable
All Known Subinterfaces:
ExposedStimuliResponseLearner, MDPLearner, StimuliResponseLearner
All Known Implementing Classes:
DumbLearner, DumbRandomLearner, MetaLearner, NArmedBanditLearner, NPTRothErevLearner, QLearner, RothErevLearner, StatelessQLearner
public interface DiscreteLearner
extends Learner

A learner that learns a discrete number of different actions.

Version:
$Revision: 1.10 $
Author:
Steve Phelps

Method Detail

act

int act()
Request that the learner perform an action. Users of the learning algorithm should invoke this method on the learner when they wish to find out which action the learner is currently recommending.

Returns:
An integer representing the action to be taken.

act

int act(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> actions)
Request that the learner perform an action that is available.

Parameters:
actions - specifies which actions are available at the moment; contains the indices of actions available
Returns:
An integer representing the action to be taken; -1 if no action can be chosen.
See Also:
act()

getNumberOfActions

int getNumberOfActions()
Get the number of different possible actions this learner can choose from when it performs an action.

Returns:
An integer value representing the number of actions available.

setNumberOfActions

void setNumberOfActions(int numActions)
Set the number of different possible actions this learner can choose from when it performs an action.

Parameters:
numActions - An integer value representing the number of actions available.
